page.title: 03GREAT MUSGRAVE RUSHBEARING
page.content:
THE ANCIENT RUSHBEARING CEREMONY IS HELD AT MUSGRAVE EVERY YEAR.LONG AGO GIRLS WOULD DANCE FROM BROUGH CARRYING FLOWERS TO ST.THEOBOLDS CHURCH AT MUSGRAVE.THE BOYS WOULD COLLECT FRESH RUSHES AND THEY WOULD BE LAID ON RUSHBEARING DAY.THE FLOOR OF THE CHURCH WOULD BE EARTH AND THE NEW RUSHES.GIRLS MAKE THEIR CROWNS WITH LOTS OF FLOWERS AND THE BOYS MAKE THEIR CROSSES WITH RUSHES.THE CROWNS AND CROSSES STAY IN THE CHURCH UNTIL THE NEXT YEAR.
FROM THE FOURTEENTH CENTURY UNTIL RECENTLY THE RUSHBEARING WAS ON MAY DAY FROM TEN A.M TILL FOUR P.M.BUT NOW IT IS ON TE FIRST SATURDAY IN JULY.
THERE ARE TWELVE YOUNG MAIDENS FROM THE BROUGH AREA. THIS IS BECAUSE THERE ARE NOT ENOUGH GIRLS IN MUSGRAVE.
